summary: Website for “वैष्णवी ई-मित्र & CSC केन्द्र” (E-Mitra & CSC centre) in कोटा (माम), करौली, showcasing services/contact/inquiry form, and now additionally includes an “Official Login” (custom username/password) to access and restore the admin/management dashboard.
architectural_notes: Site content/language: Hindi promotional content for Vaishnavi E-Mitra & CSC centre.
Key business details to display: Operator Rahul Chavariya; phone/WhatsApp +91-7426049215; location/address in Kota (Mam), Karauli.
Notification requirement clarified: notify only on new inquiry form submissions; preferred channel is email (WhatsApp requested but not supported on this platform).
User requested removal of all Admin options (no /admin dashboard and no homepage Admin Login/Admin Access section).
Reintroduce an admin/management area accessed via a custom local username/password (“Official Login”) on the homepage (note: not as secure as Internet Identity).
Login credentials specified by user: User ID K107182721; Password Karauli#34.
Post-login should restore the previous admin dashboard features (inquiry management: view/delete/mark read-unread/export).
Logout/close-tab behavior requested: return to homepage and show only “Official Login” entry (hide public sections per latest confirmation).
known_issues: Attempt to publish Draft Version 2 live/production encountered a deployment error; user requested to try going live again.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive informational website for “वैष्णवी ई-मित्र & CSC केन्द्र” that presents the business name, tagline, location (कोटा (माम), करौली), operator name (Rahul Chavariya), and contact/WhatsApp number (+91-7426049215), using the user-provided Hindi content as the primary copy.
Add a clear navigation structure (single-page sections or multi-page, developer choice) that at minimum includes: Home/Intro, Services, Why Choose Us, Contact/Address, and a Form section.

Implement a website form for customer inquiries that supports both “Contact” and “Service request” use cases by including an Inquiry Type field (e.g., dropdown) along with name, phone number, optional email, message/details, and optional service/category selection.

Apply a cohesive visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) suitable for a local digital services center. Avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors. Use Tailwind + existing UI components without editing any immutable component source files.
Add a simple footer with business name, location, operator name, and contact number, plus a brief disclaimer line (e.g., ‘Service availability may vary by government portal status.’).
Render newly generated static images (from frontend/public/assets/generated) in the site layout (hero and logo/mark) without routing images through the backend.
Create a private Admin page at the hidden route "/admin" that allows the site operator to view all inquiry form submissions, and require Internet Identity login before showing any submission data.

On the Admin page, display inquiry submissions in a readable management UI (table or cards) including: id, timestamp, inquiry type, name, phone number, optional email, message, optional service category, and whether the inquiry is internal.
Add Admin actions on inquiries: delete, mark as read/unread, and download/export submissions.
Implement React Query hooks for admin inquiry operations (list, mark read/unread, delete, export) and ensure the UI stays consistent by invalidating/refetching inquiries after mutations.
Investigate and fix the deployment error that occurs when publishing Draft Version 2 to production (live), ensuring the project can be successfully deployed without errors.

Add a new dedicated "Admin Login" section to the home/landing page that includes an "Admin Access" button; clicking the button expands/collapses and reveals the existing Internet Identity login UI (reuse the existing AdminLoginPrompt component rather than duplicating login logic).
After a successful Internet Identity login from the new home-page Admin Login section, redirect the authenticated user to the existing /admin dashboard route.
Publish the updated build to production (live) and verify the deployed site loads without build/deploy errors, including the homepage and /admin route.
Remove all admin entry points from the public marketing site UI by deleting the Admin Login section from the homepage and removing any navigation items/anchors that link to admin access.

Disable the /admin route in the SPA so the admin dashboard cannot be accessed; visiting /admin (with or without a trailing slash) must no longer render the admin page and must instead redirect to the homepage (/) or show a simple not-found/disabled message page.

Remove the admin static entry redirect so the dedicated admin entry point no longer attempts to route users into admin mode (update frontend/public/admin/index.html to redirect to the homepage without any admin redirect flags).
Ensure the public inquiry submission flow remains fully functional after removing admin UI: the inquiry form can still be submitted successfully and the user sees the existing success feedback.

Add an "Official Login" entry point on the homepage (and remove/avoid any other admin entry points) that prompts for a User ID and Password and validates against the exact credentials: User ID "K107182721" and Password "Karauli#34".

Implement a session-based official-login state that persists only for the current browser tab/session and is cleared on explicit logout and on tab/window close; when logged out, the user is returned to the normal homepage view.

Re-enable and restore the admin/management dashboard UI at route "/admin" to allow the logged-in official user to view inquiry submissions and perform actions: delete, mark as read/unread, and export/download submissions.
Update SPA routing behavior so "/admin" is no longer force-redirected to "/" when the user is officially logged in, while preserving the redirect/guard for non-logged-in users.

Update the static entrypoint at frontend/public/admin/index.html to no longer immediately redirect to "/" so that direct navigation to "/admin" can load the SPA and show the admin dashboard for an authenticated official session.
Implement React Query hooks for the restored admin inquiry operations (list, mark read/unread, delete, export) and ensure the UI stays consistent by invalidating/refetching inquiries after mutations.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an informational business website for “वैष्णवी ई-मित्र & CSC केन्द्र” including services list, address (कोटा (माम), करौली), and operator/contact details (Rahul Chavariya, +91-7426049215).
Add a website form (e.g., contact form and/or service request form).

Create backend endpoints in the single Motoko main actor to accept and store form submissions (timestamped) and to retrieve submissions for basic internal review (no public display unless explicitly enabled).
Send operator notifications for new website inquiry form submissions via email (since WhatsApp notifications were requested but are not supported).
Add an “Official Login” entry point on the homepage using a custom local username/password (User ID: K107182721, Password: Karauli#34).
After successful “Official Login”, restore/enable the admin management dashboard (view inquiries, delete, mark read/unread, export).
Implement login session/logout behavior: logging out or closing the tab should return the user to the homepage with only the “Official Login” button visible.

Extend the Motoko backend (single actor in backend/main.mo) with access-controlled inquiry management APIs needed by the restored admin dashboard: list inquiries, delete inquiry, and set read/unread, plus an export-friendly retrieval method if needed by the frontend.
